intro: Saxifraga oppositifolia narthorstii, commonly known as the Arctic sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, and its succulent, fleshy leaves adapted to cold climates. The plant thrives in rocky and barren environments, often growing on tundra or mountain slopes. It is known for its resilience to harsh conditions, including low temperatures and strong winds. Saxifraga oppositifolia narthorstii plays an important ecological role in its native habitats by providing food for various pollinators and contributing to soil stability.
